Three years ago we set up a savings account for our 12 year old son. We deposited $200 and even turned down any debit cards saying it was strictly for saving. Today we closed the account that had $8 left in it. The rest had been taken by the bank in "dormancy fees". We had started the account to hopefully show the benefits of saving money to our son. Apparently the benefits are only to the bank and none to the young customer who had trusted his money to that bank. I thought that banking greed and dishonesty was only limited to Wall Street. I was wrong.
